instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
hello, this no sign of corrosion got green orange light fan spin like 1sec 
after i removed the battery fan spins but no display no usb activity, 
i tried smc bypass fan spins high but no display (no capslock light also)
tried good clean me nothing changes

tried the whole board to other known working case inluding screen still same
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.6v 
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS3.3v
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> 3.4V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Still doesn't start with known good battery connected?
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> goes high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and traces.

You can try CPU heat test.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
SPI  resistor and traces looks okay 

cpu heat test what do u mean by this?
heat cpu with quality flux?

btw cpu is getting hot

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
1800-200 degress, no more than 15-20s.
Don't need to melt the balls; just burn eventually accumulated crap underneath.

You can also try to reball SMC.
